divs: Sighting DetailsA MORNING LIKE ANYOTHER. DRINKING COFFEE ON BACK PORCH ADMIRING THE STARS.REMAKABLY CLEAR THIS MORNING. I AM USED TO OBSERVING SAT AND METEOR. USUALLYSATS ARE NORTH TO SOUTH,AND METEOR ANY DIRECTION. THE THING ABOUT THISOBSERVATION THAT I FOUND REMAKABLE IS THE VISUAL. IT IS THE UNREMAKABLE THATOCCURED TO ME. APPERARED TRAVELING WEST. DARK, BUT AS IF REFRACTING THE CITYLIGHT. VERY FAST. MUCH FASTER THAN AIRCRAFT THAT USUALLY TRAVEL IN THIS AREA.AIRCRAFT OUT OF DFW AND LOVE FIELD USUALLY GO OVERHEAD ANY GIVEN DAY. SO FROMTHAT I WOULD SAY THAT OBJECT SPEED WAS MUCH GREATER. NO LIGHT EMMITTING FROM. NOSTROBE NOTHING. I HAVE BEEN OBSERVING AIRCRAFT ALL MY LIFE. FROM THIS I CAN ONLYGIVE A GUESS THAT THIS OBJECT WAS VERY HIGH, AND VERY FAST. ABOUT FOUR TO SIXSECONDS, VISUAL TIME. ENOUGH TIME FOR ME TO SEE STAND UP AND AQUIRE AGAIN. WASPRETTY COOL. JUST ANOTHER TO ADD TO THE LIST OF PERSONAL ENCOUNTERS WITH THEUNIVERSE. AS WITH MOST SKY OBSERVATION HERE, LIGHT POLUTION MASKED THE OBJECT INTHE END.
